Job Title: Account Executive, Employee Benefits

Location: Houston, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
What You’ll Do

 Interact professionally and timely with clients via email, phone and in-person to maintain regular, professional contact to create and foster relationships with client representatives  Responsibility for executing the Taft Hartley & Government division’s strategic direction of solutions and tools  Lead both long- and short-term strategic consultation and planning efforts for client benefit  programs  Ensure programs and plan design are in alignment with all applicable regulatory requirements including ability to lead compliance conversations/reviews with client and provide non-legal review of carrier/vendor documents/contracts  Utilize intermediate knowledge of actuarial concepts and underwriting practices to analyze claims data and provide applied explanation to the client and internal team, including ability to prepare & deliver renewal presentations if needed  Direct the service teams’ work assignments related to project management, claims escalation and resolution, and plan analysis/reporting  Responsible for ensuring client deliverables meet quality, accuracy and professional standards  Develop strong carrier and vendor relationships to support and leads negotiation and advocacy during client coverage placement and renewal process, utilizing department peers and/or leadership as necessary  Coordinate with internal subject matter experts and practice leaders to bring current and emerging markets and products and brings solutions to the table that are aligned with clients’ stated goals through a commitment to continuous learning  Experience leading & participating in new carrier implementations across multiple benefit lines such as medical, Rx, dental, vision, life/disability/leave, etc.  Availability to serve as a resource for other agency benefits staff throughout the entire benefits division  Strong commitment to participation in department or agency-wide committees and special projects  Provide mentorship & guidance to Account Managers & Analysts  May coordinate and manage the overall work and projects of assigned associates, providing clear communication of expectations, established timeframes, regular progress updates, and annual performance evaluations  Participate in the hiring process for direct reports as well as additional department hires as  needed  Provide feedback to service team members, and their direct supervisors as needed, in support of on-going professional development goals, ensuring client expectations are met  Participate in finalist and/or prospect meetings as determined by National Accounts Director & production staff  Support and demonstrate IMA’s core values  Value and understand the importance of diversity, equity, and inclusion among all IMA associates 
 You Should Have: 

Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experienceProven experience as a Lead Consultant, Analyst, Account Manager, or similar role in the employee benefits brokerage industry for 7+ years requiredPrevious experience working with clients in the Union/Public Labor sector strongly desiredAttain and maintain applicable state Life and Health License in accordance with IMA standardsWilling and able to travel required (30-50%)Proficient in using Microsoft Office suite requiredStrong understanding of compliance and regulatory requirements, such as ERISA, ACA, HIPAA, etc. requiredIn-depth knowledge of employee benefits programs, insurance products, and industry trendsExceptional client service orientation with a focus on building long-term relationshipsDemonstrate a genuine passion for acquiring new knowledge and skills, staying abreast of industry advancements and best practicesProven ability to set ambitious yet achievable goals, and consistently work towards their attainmentCapable of prioritizing tasks effectively and managing multiple client and responsibilities concurrentlyAble to work collaboratively with colleagues, supervisors, and external partners to set goals, exchange ideas, and drive resultsWillingness to embrace change, adjust goals as needed, and learn from setbacks to continually improve performancePossess the drive to pursue personal development opportunities independently, while adhering to established timelines and objectives


This Job Description is not a complete statement of all duties and responsibilities comprising this position.

The IMA Financial Group, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, The IMA Financial Group, Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

Compensation & Benefits

Being a part of IMA has its benefits. When you become part of the IMA family, you become eligible to take part in our valuable benefits and rewards package designed to benefit you, your family, and your life. Our plans are cost-effective, convenient and provide progressive ways for staying healthy, protecting loved ones, pursuing financial security and living a full and balanced life. This role is eligible for the following:

Annual Performance Bonus, Stock Purchase, Medical Plans, Prescription Drugs, Dental, Vision, Family Assistance Program, FSA, HSA, Pre-Tax Parking Plan, 401(k), Life/AD&D, Accident, Critical Illness, Hospital Indemnity, Long Term Care, Short-term Disability, Long-term Disability, Business Travel Accident, Identity Theft, Paid Time Off, Flexible Work Options, Paid Holidays, Sabbatical, Gift Matching, Health Club Reimbursement, Personal and Professional Development. In addition to our robust benefits package, the hiring range for this position is $120,000 - $160,000. While this is the targeted range, final offer amounts will depend on a variety of factors, including the candidate’s geographic location, prior relevant experience, and their knowledge, skills, and abilities. The anticipated posting timeline for this opportunity is 04/17/24 through 06/02/24.

 Why Join IMA? 

We’ve built a reputation for putting our associates first

What if we told you that you could be an integral part of an entrepreneurial, expanding company, develop lasting relationships, earn competitive benefits, plus claim part ownership? It’s this unique ownership business model that makes working at IMA so appealing.

We work in teams. We sell in teams. We win and prosper as a team

We provide support systems and resources that enable each of our associates to focus on what they do best. And as an independent company based in the Midwest, we’re big enough to write business all over the world and small enough to implement your ideas quickly.

 We are recognized nationally as a leader in our industry .

 2020-2023 Business Insurance Magazine Best Places to Work in Insurance  2023 Inc. Magazine’s Best Workplaces  2023 Denver Business Journal’s Best Places to Work  2022-2023 Connecticut Top Work Places  2021-2023 Inc. 5000’s List of Fastest Growing Companies  2019-2022 Civic 50 Colorado Honoree Recognizing 50 Most Community-Minded Companies  2022-2023 Kansas City Business Journal’s Best Places to Work 2021-2023 Charlotte Business Journal’s Best Places to Work 2021-2023 Los Angeles Business Journal’s Best Places to Work  2021-2023 The Salt Lake City Tribune Top Work Places  2021-2022 Puget Sound Business Journal’s Washington’s Best Workplaces  2021-2022 Wichita Business Journal’s Best Places to Work, #1 in extra-large category  2021 Dallas Business Journal’s Best Places to Work  2021 Alaska Journal of Commerce’s Best Workplaces in Alaska  2021 Wichita Business Journal’s Fastest Growing Companies List

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
